title: Rajgad Fort
subtitle: The Royal Capital Before Raigad
overview: Rajgad Fort, meaning 'Royal Fort', served as the first capital of the Maratha Empire under Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj before Raigad. Located about 60 km from Pune, it stands as a symbol of Maratha glory and resilience.
Constructed on the Murumbadevi Hill at a height of 4,350 feet, the fort is known for its vast size, historical structures, and scenic trekking routes.

highlights.title: Former Capital of the Maratha Empire
highlights.description: Rajgad was the first capital before Raigad and remained an important fort in Shivaji Maharaj’s rule.

highlights.title: Architectural Grandeur
highlights.description: The fort spans over 40 km and features three machis (citadels) — Suvela, Padmavati, and Sanjivani.

geography.intro: Rajgad Fort is located in the Pune district of Maharashtra, atop the Murumbadevi hill in the Sahyadri range.

climate.description: Rajgad experiences a tropical hill climate with pleasant winters and heavy monsoon rains.

seasons.text: October to February is ideal for trekking and exploration.
Monsoon offers lush greenery but slippery paths.

geography.conclusion: The fort’s strategic elevation and massive construction made it an ideal capital during the Maratha expansion.

activities.title: Trekking Adventure
activities.description: Rajgad offers one of the best treks in Maharashtra, attracting adventure enthusiasts throughout the year.
info: Multiple trekking routes: Gunjavane, Pali, and Bhutonde.

activities.title: Photography & Nature Views
activities.description: Capture panoramic views of Torna, Sinhagad, and other nearby forts.
info: Sunrise and sunset views from Balekilla are breathtaking.
Carry wide-angle lenses for landscape shots.

activities.title: Explore Historical Spots
activities.description: Visit Padmavati Temple, Suvela Machi, and Sanjivani Machi to experience Maratha history.
info: Each machi offers unique architectural and defensive significance.
Temple area often used by trekkers for overnight stays.

attractions.title: Padmavati Temple
attractions.description: A small temple dedicated to Goddess Padmavati, used as a resting spot by trekkers.

attractions.title: Sanjivani Machi
attractions.description: A long defensive structure with breathtaking views of the valley below.

marineLife.intro: Rajgad Fort lies in the Western Ghats, rich in biodiversity with lush flora and fauna.

items.title: Flora
items.description: Evergreen trees, shrubs, and monsoon wildflowers decorate the fort trail.

items.title: Fauna
items.description: Home to langurs, peacocks, monkeys, and a variety of birds.

conclusion: The natural environment complements the fort’s heritage.
Best enjoyed during early morning treks.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Private vehicles and buses available from Swargate, Pune.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Pune Junction (65 km).
From there, take local transport to Velhe village.

gallery.alt: Rajgad Fort view from the base

bookingTips.description: Start trek early morning for safe daylight climbing.
Carry rain gear and enough water, especially during monsoon treks.
Temple area can be used for overnight camping; carry sleeping bags.
